ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Costco Wholesale is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program.  This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment at the Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant.



It is the policy of the Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant to ensure that controls are in place to limit the risks of potential ammonia releases.  If such a release does occur, the facility's emergency response personnel are trained to control and mitigate the effects of the release.  The facility has coordinated emergency response activities with the Tracy Rural Fire Protection District as well as the local Hazardous Materials Response team, who provide additional emergency response expertise and support as needed.



Routine inspections by regulatory agencies such as the local fire department, Certified Unified Program Agency (San Joaquin County Environmental Health Department), USDA, etc. ensure that the facility remains in compliance and operating safely.  Costco Wholesale also institutes internal audits and inspections by both corporate environmental representatives, as well as third party consultants and contractors which enable the Tracy Meat Plant to continue safe and efficient operations.

  

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The Costco facility processes ground beef and hot dogs and produces several packaged meat products that are sold in Costco Wholesale retail locations worldwide.  The facility is located at 17880 W. Schulte Road in Tracy, California.  The ammonia refrigeration system was commissioned in 2005 and was built in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations including the Uniform Fire and Mechanical Codes.  An expansion in 2010 enabled the plant to manufacture hot dogs that are sold in

the retail locations (food courts and stores).



The Costco Tracy Meat Plant's ammonia refrigeration system uses a maximum of 45,000 pounds of ammonia for meat processing equipment (including quick freezing), warehouse cold storage, and freezer storage.  The majority of the system is located in two compressor rooms (Main Plant and Hot Dog engine rooms) including the vessels and compressors.  The condensers are mounted on the machine room rooves and all of the evaporators and process freezers are located in their respective production / cold storage areas.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant facility is in full compliance with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention (RMP) requirements as defined in 40 CFR Part 68, the requirements for the California Accidental Release Prevention program (CalARP), the Cal-OSHA PSM requirements of CCR Title 8 Section 5189, and the EPCRA Section 302 notification requirements.  The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that are in place at the Tracy Meat Plant. 



Process Safety Information 

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant maintains a detailed record of safety information that describes the chemical hazards, operating parameters, and equipment specifications associated with the ammonia refrigeration equipment and process.  This includes design parameters / specifications and safe operating conditions, as well as details of the many safety features incorporated into the design of the ammonia refrigeration system.



Process Hazards Analysis 

The facility has conducted comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with the ammonia system are identified and effectively controlled.  The HAZOP methodology, Industry Checklists, and process inspections were used to complete the process hazards analysis studies.  The studies were undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in engineering and

process operations, and have been revalidated at least every five years.  Any findings or recommendations associated with the analysis of hazards with the ammonia refrigeration system are addressed in a timely manner.



Operating Procedures 

To further ensure that activities are safely conducted regarding the ammonia refrigeration system, Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has developed detailed written operating procedures to supplement the current on-the-job operator training.  These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operation, normal shutdown and startup, and emergency shutdown and startup. This information is regularly reviewed and readily accessible to operators and/or contractors who are involved in the routine operations of the ammonia refrigeration process.  In the event of changes to either the design or operations of the ammonia system, the Operating Procedures are updated / revised to ensure they remain accurate and current.



Training 

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has an on-the-job training program in place to ensure that employees who operate ammonia process equipment are competent in the ammonia refrigeration system as well as the Operating Procedures associated with each piece of equipment.  Outside schooling resources (including both live classes and online modules) are utilized for key personnel to ensure a comprehensive understanding of continued safe operations.  Refresher training is provided at least every three years for each ammonia operator.  All training associated with the ammonia refrigeration system is documented.



Mechanical Integrity

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has a written maintenance program in place that details the preventative maintenance tasks and frequencies for all ammonia equipment to ensure continued safe operation and reliability.  Refrigeration rounds are conducted daily that require visual observation of the various ammonia components and auxiliary systems.  Any

issues noted during rounds are resolved as soon as possible.



Equipment maintained under this program includes pressure vessels, piping systems, evaporators and other process equipment (chillers, heat exchangers, ice makers, etc.), condensers, compressors, pumps, relief and vent systems, emergency shutdown systems, and auxiliary systems (ex: ammonia leak detection).  System maintenance is completed only by qualified personnel with training in maintenance practices, including in-house personnel and contractors as needed.  Specialized training is provided as needed to ensure maintenance personnel are fully qualified.  Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner. 



Management of Change 

Written procedures are followed at Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant to manage changes in the design of the ammonia process, technology, equipment, and procedures.  This ensures that ammonia operators, maintenance personnel, or any other employee whose job tasks are affected by a modification in process conditions are promptly made aware of and offered training to fully understand the scope of the modification.  Managing and reviewing changes associated with the ammonia system also ensures that no new hazards are introduced to the ammonia process.



Pre-Startup Safety Reviews 

Pre-Startup Safety Reviews related to new regulated processes and to modifications to the existing ammonia refrigeration system are conducted as a regular practice at Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant.  These written review procedures formally ensure that construction, equipment, operating and maintenance procedures are suitable for safe startup prior to placing equipment into operation, and the appropriate personnel have been properly trained / notified regarding process modifications.



Compliance Audits 

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant conducts Compliance Audits on a regular basis to verify that the provisions set out under the RMP and PS

M rules are adequate and are being implemented.  These audits have been completed at least every 3 years since the implementation of the RMP and PSM programs at the time of plant commissioning.  Any corrective actions recommended as a result of Compliance Audits are addressed / resolved in a safe and prompt manner.



Incident Investigation 

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant promptly investigates any ammonia incident that has resulted in, or could have resulted in a release of ammonia.  These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent a similar release from occurring in the future.  All Incident Investigation reports are retained for a minimum of five years.  Any corrective actions noted during Incident Investigations are addressed and resolved as soon as possible.  The Tracy Meat Plant also works closely with the local regulatory agency, San Joaquin County Environmental Health Department CUPA, to verify that corrective actions resulting from Incident Investigations are completed (with appropriate documentation).



Employee Participation 

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant believes that process safety management and accident prevention is a team effort and has developed a written plan to implement this philosophy.  Meat Plant employees are strongly encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements.  In addition, facility employees have access to all information created as part of the facility's implementation of the RMP rule, particularly information resulting from Process Hazard Analyses and Compliance Audits.  Routine meetings (typically quarterly) are conducted with ammonia refrigeration and safety personnel to ensure that any ongoing issues identified as part of the implementation of the RMP and PSM regulations are addressed.



Hot Work Permits

Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has developed a permitting procedure for all hot

work conducted in the vicinity of the ammonia equipment and/or piping.  It documents that appropriate fire prevention measures have been implemented, defines the work date, and the scope of work to be performed.  The permit ensures that the appropriate facility management personnel are aware of ongoing hot work operations and that the facility utilizes the necessary fire prevention precautions.  Hot Work Permit records are kept for at least 6 months per Cal-OSHA requirements.



Contractor Safety 

The Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant facility hires contractors to conduct ongoing maintenance and construction activities associated with the ammonia refrigeration process.  Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of the contractor's safety performance is carried out. Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has a strict policy of informing contractors of any known potential hazards related the contractor's work and the processes within the facility.  Contractors are also informed of all procedures for emergency response and evacuation should an accidental ammonia release occur.  The Tracy Meat Plant conducts annual evaluations regarding each ammonia contractor to determine long term viability at the plant.



Emergency Planning & Response

Facility personnel receive annual training regarding the emergency response procedures and the evacuation plan.  In the event that an ammonia leak is discovered, the person nearest to the leak will alert any personnel in the immediate area who are unaware of the danger, maintenance personnel, and/or their supervisor.  Maintenance Department personnel will determine what procedures and personnel are necessary to remedy the problem.  All employees will evacuate to the emergency evacuation assembly area(s).  Emergency agencies will also be notified as necessary as outlined in the Emergency Response and Planning policy.  The Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant facility also has an established relationship with the local Fire Depart

ment who may be called in to assist depending on the scope of the emergency situation.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



EPA's RMP regulation defines "accident" as the following: 



"The release must be from a covered process and involve a regulated substance held above its threshold quantity in the process. The release must have caused at least one of the following: 



?    On-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage (?68.42(a)); or

?    Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place (?68.42(a))." 



An investigation into the facility's accident history during the PHA Revalidation study performed on November 20-21, 2019, revealed that there have been no releases of ammonia over the past five years (November 2014 - November 2019) that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantity of 100 pounds in 24 hours, or that meet the EPA reporting criteria for the Five-Year Accident History as specified above. In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a release of ammonia at the Tracy Meat Plant.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant has developed a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials such as ammonia.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas. 



The facility's emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced to ensure it is properly functioning.  In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within processes that would require a modified emergency response protocol.



The facility has coordinated emergency response activities with the Tracy Rural Fire Protection District as well as the local Hazardous Materials Response team, who provide additional emergency resp

onse expertise and support as needed.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant is committed to the safety of employees as well as neighboring residents and businesses.  Continual evaluations of risks associated with the ammonia refrigeration process by in-house personnel as well as outside risk management professionals help to limit the possibility of unintended impacts from the ammonia refrigeration system.



Items identified in studies such as the recent Process Hazard Analysis Revalidation study (November 2019) and the Three-Year Compliance Audit (December 2019) will be implemented to further reduce the risks.  Costco Wholesale Tracy Meat Plant also plans to improve safety as follows:

 

?    Continued involvement of refrigeration and safety personnel in the ongoing development and implementation of the risk management policies.

?    Attendance and participation of key personnel in industry groups such as RETA and IIAR ensure the facility is aware of evolving industry standards and techniques used to encourage safety.

?    Conducting routine RMP and PSM meetings to ensure any issues identified by refrigeration personnel, contractors, consultants, or the safety department are discussed and addressed.
